Example 05: Play Playlist from Music-Library in My Sonos
Example 06: Set a morning station but dont play right now
Example 01: Play using My-Sonos - read me
info:
This is the recommended way for often uses music.

Prerequisite: You have to manually add the items to My Sonos.

name: Example 08: Group snapshot with save queue
restore group states from flow variable "householdSnapshot"
info:
# restore group states from flow variable

## Use case
- to play a notification on all players
- to listen to tv, podcast, line in  and restore after
- 
Works together with create household snapshot flow

## Customizing
 - edit `group.play.snap` and select your configuration node.
 - edit `restore from flow variable` node to define a different flow variable (optionally)

## Result
The original state is restored in all groups.

## Restrictions
What is not restored
 - the original household topology is not restore
 - the queue state such as shuffle or normal
 - the queue entries

name: create snapshop and save in flow variable "householdSnapshot"
info:
# Creates a snapshot of all group states and the topology in household.

## Use case
 - to play a notification on all players
 - to listen to tv, podcast, line in and restore after

Works together with flow to restore household snapshot.

## Customizing
 - edit `household.get.group`, `group.create.snap` and select your configuration node.
 - edit `set flow variable` node to define a different flow variable (optionally)

## Result
An array of group state snapshopts are stored in the the flow variable. That can be used to restore the household players state.

## Limitations
What is not stored: 
 - the queue state such as shuffle or normal
 - the queue entries

name: ↑just for testing
↑ just for testing
restore topologoy from flow variable "householdSnapshot"
info:
restore topologoy from flow variable "householdSnapshot"

## Use case
- to play a notification on all players and roll back

## Customizing
 - edit `household.create.group`,  and select your configuration node.
 - edit `set flow variable` node to define a different flow variable (optionally)

## Result
All household players are grouped as defined in the snapshot

## Limitation
 - The coordinator can not be set in this flow. 
 - It may take some seconds until SONOS player have finished their jobs.

## CAUTION
In case your household has a lot of players the creation of a group may take too long and therefore the group creation will fail.

name: ↑just for testing
group all players into single group
info:
# group all players into single group

## Use case
- to play a notification on all players

## Customizing
 - edit `household.get.groups`, `household.create.group` and select your configuration node.

## Result
All household players are in single group.

## Limitation
 - The coordinator is not set in this flow. 
 - It may take some seconds to complete this.

name: Example 10 Create one single group with all players
Example 02A: Home Assistant Integration Commands  - Read Me
info:
PURPOSE: 
Send commands and parameter from Home Assisant to the Universal node.

METHOD
1. Create a entity node 
    - select type "Switch"
    - In Home Assistant Config use as name "Sonos Plus Universal Node"

2. import the example 02 from the example folder

3. Create connection from entitynode to the 2 imported nodes. 
4. You can now use automation, scripts, ... 

`service: nodered.trigger
data:
  entity_id: switch.sonos_plus_universal_node
  payload:
    topic: group.stop`
    
or in case you need to transfer data: 

`entity_id: switch.sonos_plus_universal_node
payload:
  topic: group.play.tunein
  payload: s24896`
  
payload also support Home Assistant templates!

name: ↓modify
info: Select your config-node or change the IP address in this config node.

2. import the example 02 from the example folder

3. Create connection from entitynode to the 2 imported nodes. 
4. You can now use automation, scripts, ...

or in case you need to transfer data:

name: Example 02B: Home Assistant Integration - Events  - Read Me
info:
PURPOSE: 
Act on Sonos events and send data to Home Assisant

METHOD
1. Subscribe to an event from package sonos-events
2. Either use a "call service node" and change helper or submit an event with "fire event"

Example call servcie node with helper 
`Domain: input_boolean
Service: {{#payload}}turn_on{{/payload}}{{^payload}}turn_off{{/payload}}
Entity Idinput_boolean.is_beam_microphone
`

name: ↑modify - node from sonos-events package
info: Select your config-node or change the IP address in this config node.

name: use HA Node "call service" or "fire event" instead of debug node

name: Example 07: Play notification - Read me
info:
## Purpose: 
Play notification on a player an afterwards restore the origional played sound.

## Restrictions:
This is not a SONOS build in function. The current SONOS player status is captured, then the notification is played and afterwards, the status is being restored. 

If the current song has been started via an Smartphone app such as Apple or spotify, it is not possible to capture the current status and therefore the restore is not possible.

SONOS does not provide a "blocking command". So another flow with different commands, being send while a notification is playing will mess up the process. 


## Method
This flow uses a function node to serialize (queue) the incoming notifications. The status node listen on the group.play.notification and initiates playing the next notification.

name: queue
↑modify
info: Select your config node.
